title: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't perform a find operation on Mac OS X
description:
When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform a find operation. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit > Find/Replace).
2) Enter a search term in the text box.
3) Press the Enter/Return key.

Expected behavior: The Enter/Return key should perform the same action as clicking on the 'Find' button, which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog.

Actual behavior: No action is performed upon pressing the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog.
OB: Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6
SR:
To reproduce:
1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit > Find/Replace).
2) Enter a search term in the text box.
3) Press the Enter/Return key.

Expected: The Enter/Return key should perform a find operation, equivalent to clicking the 'Find' button.

Actual: No action is taken upon pressing the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog.
